sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Explosions rocked two Russian air bases, killing several people just hours before Ukraine accused Russia of launching a massive missile attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A price cap on Russian crude oil comes into force today, agreed by the EU, G7 and Australia to try and limit Moscow's export earnings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Activists brought off claims that Iran's morality police is disbanding and insist there will be no change to the conservative dress code for women.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Several people have been killed in explosions at two Russian military airfields, according to reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The origin of the blast is still unknown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Both areas are located hundreds of kilometers from the Ukrainian border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: One explosion happened near the city of Rezan, southeast of Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The other occurred at an airfield in Saratov.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Of course, the president receives information from all relevant divisions about what is happening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: On Monday, Russian President Vladimir Putin personally inspected the newly reconstructed Crimean Bridge,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: which was damaged in a car bomb attack back in October.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's a symbolic bridge connecting Russia to the peninsula of Crimea annexed by Moscow back in 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Russia blamed the act on Ukrainian military intelligence and responded with several waves of strikes on the country's energy infrastructure. Ukrainian officials have not directly claimed responsibility for the blast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian officials have indicated that Ukrainian forces plan to continue offensive operations over

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: the coming winter to capitalize on recent battlefield successes and prevent Russian forces from regaining the battlefield initiative.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Institute for the Study of War states that Ukraine's ability to maintain the military initiative and continue the momentum of its current operational successes depends on Ukrainian forces continuing to conduct successive operations through the winter 2022-2023.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: operations through the winter 2022-2023. Now the think tank says that Russia lost the initiative in summer after its offensive in Donbass culminated. Ukrainian forces gained and have retained the initiative since August 2022 and have been conducting a series of successful successive operations since then. Liberating most of Kharkiv region in September, Kherson city in November and is currently setting conditions for more Ukrainian pushes elsewhere this winter. Now these could be the northeast of Ukraine around the Svatova and Krimina area where Ukrainian forces continue their counteroffensive operations. And some of the most fierce fighting is in the east of Ukraine, specifically that's around Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russian operations are continuing to expand manpower, ammunition and other military assets while making limited tactical gains that have limited operational utility, as the Institute for the Study of War has previously assessed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The UK Defence Ministry adds that Russia has prioritised Bakhmut as its main offensive effort since early August.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However, the campaign has been disproportionately costly relative to these possible gains. There is a realistic possibility that Bakhmut's capture has become primarily a symbolic political objective for Russia. The capture of the town of Bakhmut would have limited operational value, although it would potentially allow Russia to threaten the larger urban areas of Kramatorsk and Slovetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The price cap on Russian crude oil agreed by Australia, the EU and G7 nations comes into effect today,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: with a cap on refined petroleum products due in February next year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: with a cap on refined petroleum products due in February next year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The deal sets the oil price per barrel at a maximum of 60 US dollars, or roughly 57 euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But Ukraine had asked for a lower cap of 30 dollars per barrel, arguing that any higher won't have an impact on Russia's economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Moscow, meanwhile, has said it will continue to sell its oil at market price.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Most oil tankers are insured by institutions in G7 countries. And unless the vessels accept the price cap, they won't be able to get coverage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Therefore, even countries that haven't agreed to the ceiling could be forced to enforce it, which could in turn limit Russia's energy export earnings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But according to the Financial Times newspaper, Moscow has prepared a fleet of tankers bought from Venezuela and Iran to try and circumvent the cap.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Campaigners backing Iran's protest movement dismissed a claim over the weekend the Islamic

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Republic is disbanding its notorious morality police. There have also been calls on social media for a three-day strike more than two months after the death of 22-year-old Masa Amini.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Human rights defender Masa Al-Mardani says articles within the Islamic Penal Code remain and insists nothing will change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It has been some weeks that a lot of folks in Iran have not seen the morality police around.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But is this a positive change?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: No.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There has been an influx of other security forces on the ground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And these security forces have been documented to shoot, kill, beat, arrest protesters, and take them into custody, inflict torture without any due process or any proper criminal charges against protesters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's going to be a massive distraction because anyone who knows Iran knows that the Morality Police is not the problem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In a surprise move, Attorney General Mohammad Jafar Montazeri announced the abolition of the Morality Police, a much feared force created to quote spread the culture of decency and the hijab.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Some suggest the administration might finally be bowing to protesters while the local media is skeptical.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's been six years since the deadly 2016 Brussels attacks which claimed the lives of 32 people and injured over 300.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: and injured over 300.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Now, 10 defendants are set to stand trial, including Salah Abdeslam, one of the perpetrators of the Paris attacks one year prior.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The attacks are considered the worst to have occurred in Belgium during peacetime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The airport and the metro system were targeted by bombers during rush hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The attackers detonated two explosive devices at the airport departure halls and one at the metro station.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Maelbeek station in central Brussels near the EU headquarters was devastated by the bombing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As it is the largest criminal trial in Belgian history, proceedings are expected to last until June, with hundreds of witnesses and victims set to testify.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Victims and their families hope justice will be served at this trial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Sierra Leone's capital, Freetown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Drivers of the city's tricycle taxis lining up in front of a petrol station in the vain hope of being able to buy some fuel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: After several months of severe shortages, the queues grow longer and the price steeper.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: If I come at the gas station and there is no gas, I will go to the black market, the Jebu, where people sell it in bottles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They sell it in the black market for 30 lions for one litre.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: When we came, we were expecting to buy petrol at 21,000 lions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: If I want to buy five litres, it will cost me 105,000.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I will ride with this for the rest of the day and I will have to pay my boss 80,000 to rent it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I also have to eat and maintain the bike, change the oil, so I have to do all of these things. But if we have this fuel crisis, it affects us. And now we can't buy directly from the petrol station. We buy at the black market for 30,000 Leons for a litre. In March, the government fixed the official price of fuel at 21,000 Leons, almost double that of last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And it's not only motorists and the economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In August, at least 25 people died in Freetown when protests against fuel and food prices turned violent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: As concern over climate change and the need for clean energy

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: sees an increasing number of people switch to electric cars, these vehicles are fast gaining a larger market share.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But some experts are asking how green the batteries that run them really are.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: They're raising questions about the environmental impact of lithium mining, respect for human rights and alleged child labor in cobalt mines, the high energy costs of production and a recyclability rate of barely 10 percent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Recycling of materials of batteries at this moment is not that interesting for recyclers nor for manufacturers because it's much cheaper to extract virgin materials than to recycle them.

sentences.sentence: A Spanish company is trying to give used car batteries a second life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: As part of the EU project Stardust, it's reconditioning them to store solar energy, adding at least 10 years to their life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The aging of our batteries have been a lot better than expected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: of our batteries have been a lot better than expected.
